Class Zone

java.lang.Object
com.github.cowwoc.digitalocean.resource.Zone
public final class Zone extends Object

  • Constructor Details

    • Zone

      public Zone(Zone.Id id, String name, Set<ZoneFeature> features, boolean canCreateDroplets, Set<DropletType.Id> dropletTypes)
      Creates a new instance.
      Parameters:
      id - the zone's ID
      name - the name of this zone
      features - features that are available in this zone
      canCreateDroplets - true if new Droplets can be created in this zone
      dropletTypes - the types of Droplets that can be created in this zone
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if any of the arguments are null
      IllegalArgumentException - if name contains leading or trailing whitespace or is empty

  • Method Details

    • id

      public static Zone.Id id(String value)
      Creates a new ID.
      Parameters:
      value - the server-side identifier (slug)
      Returns:
      the type-safe identifier for the resource
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if value contains leading or trailing whitespace or is empty

    • getAll

      public static Set<Zone> getAll(DigitalOceanClient client) throws IOException, TimeoutException, InterruptedException
      Returns all the zones.
      Parameters:
      client - the client configuration
      Returns:
      an empty set if no match is found
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if client is null
      IllegalStateException - if the client is closed
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs. These errors are typically transient, and retrying the request may resolve the issue.
      TimeoutException - if the request times out before receiving a response. This might indicate network latency or server overload.
      InterruptedException - if the thread is interrupted while waiting for a response. This can happen due to shutdown signals.

    • getByPredicate

      public static Zone getByPredicate(DigitalOceanClient client, Predicate<Zone> predicate) throws IOException, TimeoutException, InterruptedException
      Returns the first VPC that matches a predicate.
      Parameters:
      client - the client configuration
      predicate - the predicate
      Returns:
      null if no match is found
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if any of the arguments are null
      IllegalStateException - if the client is closed
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs. These errors are typically transient, and retrying the request may resolve the issue.
      TimeoutException - if the request times out before receiving a response. This might indicate network latency or server overload.
      InterruptedException - if the thread is interrupted while waiting for a response. This can happen due to shutdown signals.
